paper_title: Photo reduction of CO 2 to methanol via TiO 2 photocatalyst

result.query: What is the chemical name of the catalyst used in the experiment?

evidences.pdf_reference: Reaction products were analyzed via a sampling loop of 2.5 ml on-line by a GC/FID equipped with a 2 m long Porapak Q column.Analysis results indicated that methanol was the dominant hydrocarbon.Blank reactions were carried out to ensure that hydrocarbon production was solely from the photoreduction of CO 2 .One blank was UV-illuminated without the catalyst, and another was in the dark with the catalyst and CO 2 under the same experimental conditions.No hydrocarbon was detected in the above blank tests.
evidences.generated_facts:
Facts:
1. The reaction products were analyzed using a sampling loop.
2. GC/FID equipment was equipped with a Porapak Q column.
3. A Porapak Q column was used by the GC/FID equipment.
4. Methanol was detected as a hydrocarbon in the analysis results.
5. Hydrocarbons are produced from the photoreduction of CO2.
6. Blank reactions were carried out to ensure that hydrocarbon production came solely from the photoreduction of CO2.
7. A catalyst was present in the blank reactions.
8. CO2 was used in the blank reactions.
9. UV-illumination was applied to one of the blank reactions.
10. Dark conditions were applied to another blank reaction.
11. The hydrocarbon produced in the analysis results is also detected as a hydrocarbon.
12. Methanol is classified as a type of hydrocarbon.
13. Hydrocarbons are present in the analysis results.
14. Blank reactions did not produce any hydrocarbons when exposed to UV-illumination or dark conditions.

evidences.pdf_reference:
Article_Title
Photo reduction of CO 2 to methanol via TiO 2 photocatalyst
Abstract
evidences.generated_facts:
Facts: 
1. The article "Photo reduction of CO 2 to methanol via TiO 2 photocatalyst" is about the photo reduction of CO 2 to methanol using TiO 2 as a photocatalyst.
2. CO 2 is a type of carbon dioxide molecule.
3. CO 2 is a type of molecule.
4. TiO 2 is a type of titanium dioxide material.
5. TiO 2 is a type of material.
6. A photocatalyst is a concept or idea.
7. A photocatalyst is a process or method of reducing CO 2 to methanol.

evidences.pdf_reference: less than 20 ppb.bubbled through a water saturator to carry moisture.The partial pressure of moisture could be adjusted by the temperature of saturator.The reactor was tightly closed during the reaction and was purged one hour using helium before switching to CO 2 .The flow rate of CO 2 was 3 ml/min and equivalent to residence time of 5000 seconds.Total pressure was in the range of 1.05 1.4 bar.All reaction data was taken at steady state which attained in near one hour after turning on UV light. Reaction products were analyzed via a sampling loop of 2.5 ml on-line by a GC/FID equipped with a
evidences.generated_facts:
Facts:
1. Water is carried by ppb.
2. Saturator bubbles moisture through.
3. Partial pressure of moisture is controlled by temperature.
4. Partial pressure of moisture is adjusted by saturator.
5. Reactor was tightly closed during the reaction.
6. Helium was purged with reactor.
7. CO2 was switched to reactor after purging with helium.
8. Flow rate is equivalent to residence time.
9. Residence time equals 5000 seconds.
10. Total pressure ranges between 1.05 and 1.4 bar.
11. Data for reaction was taken at steady state.
12. Steady state was attained near one hour after turning on UV light.
13. On-line analysis of reaction products is done using sampling loop.
14. GC/FID has a detector or component.
15. Reactor was purged using ppb.
16. Helium was purged with reactor before switching to CO2.

evidences.pdf_reference: TiO 2 surface were Cu 2 O clusters, and played an important role for the formation of methanol.The methanol yield increased with UV irradiative intensity.Photo activity increased with increasing Cu loadings.Maximum methanol rate was 0.45 mole/g-cathr using 1.2 wt-Cu/TiO 2 catalyst under 16 W/cm 2 irradiation, 1.3 bar pressure of CO 2 , and 5000 seconds mean residence time.Higher than 1.2 wt Cu loading gave less rate of methanol yield because of the masking effect of Cu 2 O clusters on the surface of TiO 2 .
evidences.generated_facts:
Facts:
1. TiO2 has Cu2O clusters as surface.
2. TiO2 plays a role in the formation of methanol.
3. Methanol yield increases with UV irradiation intensity.
4. Photocatalysis activity increases with increasing Cu loadings.
5. Catalyst is made of TiO2 and Cu.
6. Cu forms clusters on the surface of TiO2.
7. Methanol yield rate is 0.45 mole/g-cathr under certain conditions.
8. UV irradiation intensity increases with increasing Cu loadings.
9. CO2 pressure is 1.3 bar under certain conditions.
10. Residence time is 5000 seconds under certain conditions.
11. Higher Cu loadings give a lower methanol yield rate than 1.2 wt-Cu/TiO2.
12. UV irradiation intensity of 16 W/cm² is required for maximum methanol yield rate under certain conditions.
13. A residence time of 5000 seconds is required for maximum methanol yield rate under certain conditions.

evidences.pdf_reference: and assembled to transmit and spread light uniformly inside reactor.TiO 2 film was coated on optical fiber using dip-coating method.Titania and Cu-loaded solutions were prepared by a thermal hydrolysis method.The thickness of Cu/TiO 2 film was 53 nm and consisted of very fine spherical particle with diameter of near 14 nm.The XRD spectra indicated the anatase phase of all TiO 2 and Cu/TiO 2 films.The wavelength of absorption edge was on 367 nm, equivalent to near 3.3 eV.Most active Cu species on TiO 2 surface were Cu 2 O clusters, and played an important role for the formation of methanol.The
evidences.generated_facts:
Facts: 
1. The reactor contains optical fiber.
2. Optical fiber has a TiO2 film.
3. The TiO2 film was coated on optical fiber using the dip-coating method.
4. Titania is equivalent to Cu-loaded solutions.
5. Thermal hydrolysis method was used to prepare Cu-loaded solutions.
6. Cu-loaded solutions were prepared by thermal hydrolysis method.
7. The TiO2 film has a thickness of 53 nm.
8. The Cu/TiO2 film consists of very fine spherical particles with a diameter near 14 nm.
9. XRD spectra indicated the anatase phase of all TiO2 and Cu/TiO2 films.
10. The anatase phase is present in all TiO2 and Cu/TiO2 films.
11. The wavelength of absorption edge was equivalent to near 3.3 eV.
12. The energy (eV) is equivalent to the wavelength of absorption edge.
13. Methanol was formed by Cu2O clusters on the surface of TiO2.
14. Cu2O clusters played an important role in the formation of methanol.

evidences.pdf_reference: Greenhouse gas such as CO 2 is the primary cause of global warming.Alternative energy source should be provided without producing more CO 2 , such as solar energy.One of the best routes to remedy CO 2 is to transform it to hydrocarbons using photo reduction.In our study, CO 2 was photocatalytically reduced to produce methanol using a Hg lamp with wavelength 365 nm in a steady-state optical-fiber photo reactor.The optical-fiber photo reactor, comprised of near 120 Cu/TiO 2 -coated fibers, was designed and assembled to transmit and spread light uniformly inside reactor.TiO 2 film was coated on
evidences.generated_facts:
Facts:
1. CO2 (Carbon Dioxide) causes Global warming.
2. Solar energy reduces CO2 emissions.
3. Hydrocarbons can be produced by transforming CO2 through photo reduction.
4. Methanol is produced by photocatalytically reducing CO2 using a Hg lamp.
5. The optical-fiber photo reactor spreads light uniformly inside the reactor.
6. TiO2 (Titanium dioxide) film coats the optical-fiber photo reactor.
7. Cu (Copper) is used in near 120 Cu/TiO2-coated fibers of the optical-fiber photo reactor.

Note: I've rephrased some relationships to make them more concise and clear, while maintaining their original meaning.

evidences.pdf_reference: LEO 1530 (Germany).X-ray photoelectron spectroscopy (XPS) was conducted for elemental analysis on a spectrometer of VG Microtech MT500. An optical-fiber photo reactor (OFPR), comprised of TiO 2 -coated fibers, was designed and assembled to transmit light form one end of the OFPR module to the fiber-supported TiO 2 film as shown in Figure 2. Near 120 fibers with 16 cm long were inserted into the OFPR, which had a diameter of 3.2 cm and was 16 cm long.The both sides of OFPR were sealed using O-rings and passed the leakage test.Figure 3 schematically illustrates the reactor system.The OFPR was

2. The VG Microtech MT500 was used for X-ray photoelectron spectroscopy.
3. TiO2 is coated on an Optical-fiber photo reactor.
4. The OFPR module contains a Fiber-supported TiO2 film.
5. The OFPR has a diameter of 3.2 cm.
6. The OFPR has a length of 16 cm.
7. The OFPR is sealed with O-rings.
